name: Petrified Forest National Park
description: Park Hours: 8am to 5pm, MST. Don't forget that Arizona does not observe Daylight Savings. Petrified Forest is best known for its Triassic fossils. It's like having two parks in one, an ecosystem over 200 million years old with plants and animals now represented in the surreal landscape of the Painted Desert. There is also a living park with its own denizens adapted to a demanding environment.
shortDescription: Park Hours: 8am to 5pm, MST. Don't forget that Arizona does not observe Daylight Savings. Petrified Forest is best known for its Triassic fossils. It's like having two parks in one, an ecosystem over ...

operatingHours.description: Park Road hours of operation may change due to weather or safety issues. Closed Thanksgiving and Christmas.

fees.title: Entrance - Private Vehicle
fees.description: Admits one private, non-commercial vehicle (15-passenger capacity or less) and all occupants. Valid for 7 days.

fees.title: Entrance - Per Person
fees.description: Admits one individual with no motor vehicle (bicyclist, hiker, pedestrian). Youth 15 and under are admitted free of charge. Valid for 7 days.

fees.title: Entrance - Motorcycle
fees.description: Valid for 7 days. Admits up to 2 private, non-commercial motorcycles with up to 4 total passengers.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Sedan
fees.description:
$25 flat fee + $10 per person (Sedans, SUVs, Minivans)

If you are conducting an income generating tour of the park, you are subject to commercial tour fees. Fees for commercial vehicles are based on the capacity of the vehicle, not the number of passengers on board, and are valid for 7 days.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Per Person
fees.description:
$25 flat fee + $10 per person (Sedans, SUVs, Minivans)

If you are conducting an income generating tour of the park, you are subject to commercial tour fees. Fees for commercial vehicles are based on the capacity of the vehicle, not the number of passengers on board, and are valid for 7 days.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Van
fees.description:
Capacity of 7 to 15 passengers - $50 (Vans).

If you are conducting an income generating tour of the park, you are subject to commercial tour fees. Fees for commercial vehicles are based on the capacity of the vehicle, not the number of passengers on board, and are valid for 7 days.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Mini-bus
fees.description:
Capacity of 16-25 passengers - $60

If you are conducting an income generating tour of the park, you are subject to commercial tour fees. Fees for commercial vehicles are based on the capacity of the vehicle, not the number of passengers on board, and are valid for 7 days.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Motor Coach
fees.description:
Capacity of 26+ passengers - $150 (Large tour buses, motorcoaches).

If you are conducting an income generating tour of the park, you are subject to commercial tour fees. Fees for commercial vehicles are based on the capacity of the vehicle, not the number of passengers on board, and are valid for 7 days.

fees.title: Entrance - Non-commercial Groups
fees.description:
Capacity of 16 or more $15/person.  Anyone that is 15 or younger is exempt from paying an entrance fee, in addition to anyone with a valid pass. A pass may cover immediate family members or up to 4 people traveling with the group.

A non-commercial organized group is a group traveling together, such as scouts, a club, a church, or other group that has organized its own itinerary. Fees are based on the capacity of the vehicle, not the number of passengers on board, and are valid for 7 days.

climate.weatherDescription: Petrified Forest National Park is a semi-arid grassland. Temperatures range from above 100° F (38° C) to well below freezing. About 10 inches (25.4 cm) of moisture comes during infrequent snow in the winter and often dramatic summer thunder-storms. Animals and plants are adapted to extremes in temperature and moisture. You should be ready too. Check out the forecast before you arrive and plan accordingly.

images.title: Petrified Forest National Wilderness Area
images.altText: Sunlit Painted Desert hills of the Petrified Forest National Wilderness Area
images.caption: Sunrise and sunset are favorite times to view the colorful Painted Desert of the Petrified Forest National Wilderness Area

images.title: Painted Desert Inn National Historic Landmark
images.altText: Sunset lights up the Painted Desert Inn National Historic Landmark west side.
images.caption: Sunset lights up the Painted Desert Inn National Historic Landmark west side.

images.title: Agate House
images.altText: Sunlight highlights the colorful petrified wood of Agate House
images.caption: Agate House was built over 900 years ago out of pieces of petrified wood

images.title: Puerco Pueblo
images.altText: Masonry wall foundations are all that are left of a hundred room pueblo
images.caption: Masonry wall remnants are all that are left of a hundred room pueblo.

images.title: Blue Mesa Trail
images.altText: Two visitors walk the Blue Mesa Trail between blue, purple, and grey badlands.
images.caption: Visitors enjoy the otherworldly walk along the Blue Mesa.

images.title: Jasper Forest
images.altText: many petrified logs lay on the ground and on eroded pedestals of clay
images.caption: Jasper Forest has some of the most colorful logs in the park.

images.title: Summer Solstice Petroglyph at Puerco Pueblo
images.altText: A beam of light touches a petroglyph at Puerco Pueblo on the summer solstice
images.caption: A petroglyph at Puerco Pueblo interacts with the sunlight on the summer solstice.

images.title: Mountain Lion Petroglyph
images.altText: a petroglyph pecked into sandstone that represents a mountain lion
images.caption: This ancient petroglyph of a mountain lion has become an icon of the park.

images.title: Paleontological Excavation
images.altText: Researchers dig for fossils in the badlands
images.caption: Researchers dig for fossils in the badlands.

images.title: Colorful Piece of Petrified Wood
images.altText: yellow and other colors in a piece of brightly colored petrified wood
images.caption: Iron oxide is one of the many trace minerals that create the color of petrified wood.
